question: [File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 24] [Multisig Filtering] When filtering Multisig transactions, are both the multisig_address and inner transaction payload properly filtered, or can attackers hide malicious payloads inside multisig wrappers? (High)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 24] [FeePayer Transactions] Can FeePayer transactions bypass filters by distributing suspicious addresses across sender, secondary_signers, and fee_payer fields, with no single field triggering filters? (High)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 24] [MultiAgent Transactions] Can MultiAgent transactions with many secondary_signers cause performance issues during filtering if each signer must be checked against PublicKey or AccountAddress filters? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 24] [Abstract Authenticator] Can Abstract authenticator's function_info.module_address be used to impersonate filtered addresses, or is it properly validated by AccountAddress matchers? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 24] [FederatedKeyless] When FederatedKeyless public keys are matched by AccountAddress via jwk_addr, can attackers register malicious JWK addresses that bypass filters? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 24] [EncryptedPayload Filtering] When TransactionFilter encounters EncryptedPayload, can it properly extract and match the encrypted executable and extra_config, or do encrypted transactions bypass filtering entirely? (Critical)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 24] [EncryptedPayload Decryption Failure] If EncryptedPayload.executable_ref() returns an error during filtering, are these transactions rejected or allowed by default, potentially bypassing security checks? (High)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 24] [Payload V1 Filtering] Are TransactionPayload::Payload(TransactionPayloadInner::V1) transactions properly filtered, or can future payload versions bypass current filter implementations? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 24] [Script Transactions] Can Script transactions bypass EntryFunction and ModuleAddress filters since they don't call specific modules, potentially executing arbitrary bytecode? (High)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 24] [ModuleBundle Transactions] Are ModuleBundle transactions (publishing multiple modules) filtered, or can attackers publish malicious modules that bypass module address filters? (High)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 59] [BatchId Filtering] Can attackers predict or manipulate BatchId values to avoid BatchId-based filters in BatchTransactionFilter? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 59] [BatchAuthor Filtering] When filtering by BatchAuthor (PeerId), can compromised validators rotate their PeerIds to evade BatchAuthor filters? (High)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 59] [Batch-Transaction Mismatch] If BatchTransactionFilter has both batch-level and transaction-level matchers, can attackers exploit rule ordering to make batch matchers override transaction matchers or vice versa? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 70-72] [Batch Filter is_enabled()] If batch filter is disabled during batch voting, can malicious batches be certified by validators, even though they would be rejected during block execution? (High)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 59] [Empty Batch Handling] How are empty batches handled by BatchTransactionFilter - are they allowed or denied by default, and can this be exploited for resource exhaustion? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 94] [Block Author Filtering] When filtering by block Author, does None author (for genesis or special blocks) bypass Author filters, potentially allowing malicious genesis transactions? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 94] [Block ID Prediction] Can attackers predict future BlockIds to craft transactions that will match BlockId filters at specific future blocks? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 94] [Epoch Range Attacks] Can attackers exploit epoch ranges (EpochGreaterThan/LessThan) to include transactions during specific epochs when filtering is weak or transitioning? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 105-112] [Block Filter is_enabled()] If execution_filter is disabled during block execution, can validators execute different transaction sets from the same block, causing state divergence? (Critical)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 94] [Block-Transaction Rule Ordering] Can block-level matchers (All, Author, BlockId, Epoch, Timestamp) short-circuit transaction-level matchers, allowing malicious transactions in trusted blocks? (High)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Panic Safety] Can any filter configuration cause panic during deserialization or method calls, potentially crashing validator nodes? (High)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 36-43] [is_empty() Failure] If the underlying filter's is_empty() method fails or panics, does is_enabled() safely handle this, or can it cause cascading failures? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Deserialization Errors] Are deserialization errors for TransactionFiltersConfig properly propagated and logged, or can silent failures cause nodes to run with incorrect filter configurations? (High)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 10-11] [Unknown Field Handling] Does deny_unknown_fields cause deserialization to fail loudly with clear errors, or can it lead to confusing failures that operators might ignore? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Null/Empty Value Handling] How are null or explicitly empty values in JSON/YAML configs handled - do they create disabled filters or fail deserialization? (Low)
